title: Comparative Analysis and Application of Team Learning Approaches: A Practical Guide for Mathematics Education

context.prior_knowledge: Basic Mathematics Concept Understanding and Team Project Experience
context.additional_context: Primarily smartphone-based learning activities with weekly offline sessions, emphasizing mathematical applications through real-life problem-solving

learning_goals: Learners can distinguish and explain the core characteristics of three team-learning approaches: action learning, problem-based learning, and project-based learning.
Learners can design a proposal by applying team-learning strategies suited to mathematical education contexts in real-world case studies.
Learners can write a report evaluating team-learning effectiveness by analyzing collaborative and feedback processes.

constraints.tech_requirements: Limited tech environment (no PC, smartphone only)

difficulty: Hard - Complex requirements with multiple constraints
